notes: These are convenience, approximately-Gaussian H0 constraints intended for stress-testing the audit chain.

Where published errors are asymmetric or split into stat/sys components, we record the source values and also provide a symmetric 'sigma' for use in gaussian_measurement (typically an average or quadrature).
These constraints are not treated as independent of the SN ladder/SN-only datasets (they share data/assumptions); they are used only as a bracketing sensitivity test.

reference.title: Measurements of the Hubble Constant: Tensions in Perspective
reference.note: Review summarizing TRGB-based H0 with separate stat/sys components.

reference.title: H0LiCOW XIII. A 2.4% measurement of H0 from lensed quasars
reference.note: Uses time-delay strong lensing; asymmetric errors approximated symmetrically for this stress-test.

reference.title: TDCOSMO IV. Hierarchical time-delay cosmography: mass models and H0
reference.note: Constraint reported for the combined TDCOSMO+SLACS analysis; asymmetric errors approximated symmetrically for this stress-test.

reference.title: The Megamaser Cosmology Project. XIII. H0 from Angular-diameter Distances
reference.note: Quoted as an approximately Gaussian constraint for this audit-chain stress test.

reference.title: The Hubble Constant from Infrared Surface Brightness Fluctuation Distances
reference.note: SBF determination with separate stat/sys errors; combined in quadrature for this stress-test.

reference.title: STRIDES: a 3.9 per cent measurement of the Hubble constant from the strong lens system DES J0408âˆ’5354
reference.note: Asymmetric errors approximated symmetrically for this stress-test.
